main event: A ground-radar displayed a high-speed, occasionally tilting object traveling on a straight path South in Detroit, Michigan on 16 August 1952.
interesting points: The object was observed traveling at a high speed and occasionally tilting, indicating unusual movement.
The document was initially classified but downgraded to unclassified due to an error, suggesting potential mishandling of UFO reports.
A sighting at Detroit Metropolitan Airport described a craft with oscillating lights, approximately 15 feet in diameter, and flashing lights resembling navigation lights.
Another sighting reported a round 'white object' blinking near the face every second, brighter than a star, and exhibiting repeated appearances and changes in size.
Description of another sighting in Grand Rapids, Michigan, noted a round, 7-8 feet bright blue object approaching in formation, with no apparent motion or sound.
sighted object: high-speed, occasionally tilting object visible on ground-radar
location: Detroit, Michigan and Grand Rapids, Michigan
witnesses: ground-radar, eyewitnesses at Detroit Metropolitan Airport and Grand Rapids, Michigan
photographs: no, the report does not include photographs
